> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> > I suppose that contract could be:
> > 
> > 0 <= newCollection.size - oldCollection.size <= 1
> > 
> 
>  From what I understand of DBC, I'm not sure that this would be a 
> precise enough contract.  I think I could pretty easily write a bad 
> implementation that always meets the contract: never add the 
> object to 
> the container, so new.size()-old.size() always equals 0.

There also needs to be a

 newCollection.contains(newElement)

Now, of course, we depend on the implementation (and therefore the
contract) of contains...

I wonder how you would know that your contract is sufficient and that
your implementation is minimally complying to it. Someone suggested
doing "contract-driven-development"; if there really is someone who
already tried something like that, I would really like to see an
example...

Regards, Ilja
